Back to top                  TarsTarkas    Joined: 20 Dec 2007 		    Posts: 5253 		    Location: Virginia, United States 		        Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 3:46 am            As a fan of the franchise, the anime will still be a must watch for me, no matter how bad it could get.   My main concern is how the second season will handle the content, that was skipped over in the first season.  Since the first season was nothing more than a travelogue.   spoiler[They glossed over Verbergen and skipped the encounters with the Hoelscher Empire.]  It would be a shame if they excised these from the anime, since spoiler[ the blood bath in the Empire was a glorious moment in the light novel]      Back to top                  Cryten    Joined: 19 Jan 2019 		    Posts: 541       Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 6:13 am            Well I cant get as much fun dunking on the series anymore, since its actually competent now even if it doesnt stand out. Actually from the preview I thought it might be a bunch of stills again but we are normally getting at least a few frames of swinging a weapon animation now. Its a plus!   Though without it being atrocious it feels a bit more average now. Perhaps that is because we have had a few more of the chuni style wacky leads in the last 2 years. Like Kemono Michi, Combatants will be dispatched and quite a few I rule out as close to chuni but not overtly such as Reincarnated as a Spider and Fruit of Evolution.   For ep 2, I dont believe for a single second that Hajime could be threatened. More likely the old staple of getting his reward stolen to try and create a credible threat. Though I think the series would more likely go for just overwhelming a foe who thinks he's got him on the hop.      Back to top                  borisdrakoni    Joined: 27 Apr 2019 		    Posts: 23       Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 10:17 am              TarsTarkas wrote:    As a fan of the franchise, the anime will still be a must watch for me, no matter how bad it could get.   My main concern is how the second season will handle the content, that was skipped over in the first season.  Since the first season was nothing more than a travelogue.   spoiler[They glossed over Verbergen and skipped the encounters with the Hoelscher Empire.]  It would be a shame if they excised these from the anime, since spoiler[ the blood bath in the Empire was a glorious moment in the light novel]      There's always the possibility that this season won't get to the part in the story where the skipped content from season 1 becomes relevant.   The pacing so far has been fairly steady, and with only 12 aired episodes listed volume 6 would probably be a better stopping point.  As far as the spoiler[Empire] is concerned, I wouldn't be too surprised if at least spoiler[Gahard] was retroactively introduced here in the next couple of episodes when the story checks in on the Hero party side since spoiler[they don't have much to do for awhile].   So far, I've been enjoying the second season.  Though far from top tier, the animation quality is noticeably improved, and the writing doesn't seem to be in as big of a hurry as season 1 to speed run through the content.  The new opening and ending themes are quite good, and Ryou Takahashi's work on the bgms is as on point as always.  Of course, the return of the weekly Twitter shorts are also a welcome injection of comedy into the story.  We'll have to see where things go, but from the first two episodes at least there's plenty of room for some cautious optimism.      Back to top                  sadoldguy    Joined: 01 Aug 2009 		    Posts: 38       Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 11:07 am            "Make out" session, right.  I tolerate the light novel and manga enough but never watched the first season, so my impression is that they upped the edgelord aspects but toned down the sex and violence.      Back to top                  Picky33    Joined: 09 Jul 2021 		    Posts: 215       Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 4:34 pm            After how long it's been since the first season i was surprised to get another. I really enjoyed the first season. my only worry with the first episode is they haven't done any explaining so anyone who never read the LN, Manga, Watched the first season won't have any good understandings of what's going on.    Looking at the first episode without any context it's hard to follow along. Hopefully that improves in subsequent episodes (only watched the first so far).      Back to top                  TarsTarkas    Joined: 20 Dec 2007 		    Posts: 5253 		    Location: Virginia, United States 		        Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 1:42 am            I watched the first two episodes, so this definitely is a step up from the first season.  Wished that the OP was a bit more exciting, but at least this OP was slightly better than the first season's horrible OP.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3765       Posted: Sun Jan 30, 2022 12:17 am            Even if it was because he got the drop on him, it's nice to see an antagonist that's actually giving Hajime some trouble for once.    It was nice to see some Tio spotlight and to see her proclaim her love for Hajime. I wonder if Shea will get a spotlight episode this season.    Seems like there's intrigue back with Hajime's old classmates...I almost forgot about the conspiracy going on. Dude really just doesn't get how little Hajime cares about the attempted murder or Kaori going along with him, but now he's basically asking for Hajime to kill him.   Shizuku's one weakness...cats. Catgirl Shizuku was adorable.      Back to top                  Fallout3Boi    Joined: 05 Feb 2022 		    Posts: 1       Posted: Sat Feb 05, 2022 5:14 am            My only thought? Remia's hair looks darker in the LN.   On another note though, at this point in season 2. Remia is only pretending to like Hajime as so not to hurt Myuu's feelings.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3765       Posted: Sat Feb 05, 2022 10:48 am            I love Yue just casually sitting on Hajime's crotch and undressing so she and Hajime could have sub sex. That's couple goals.    Poor Shea gives up her blood and then has to catch Hajime and Yue at the end of their lovemaking. Throw her a bone, Hajime!   I love how Kaori finally gets her moment with Hajime only for Tio to interrupt it and shove Hajime into her boobs.   Sayaka Ohara playing a hot anime mom. It's almost becoming her thing as much as it is Kikuko Inoue's. What's funny is I was reminded on reddit that she had already played Shea's mom in a flashback, which implies that either they forgot about it and just cast her as another mom or Sayaka Ohara is going to play every characters' mom.    Really curious where the intrigue in the kingdom is going and if it'll intersect with Hajime's story at all this season...and now Shizuku knows Hajime did something to Ai-chan.      Back to top                  borisdrakoni    Joined: 27 Apr 2019 		    Posts: 23       Posted: Sat Feb 05, 2022 11:54 am              MFrontier wrote:      Sayaka Ohara playing a hot anime mom. It's almost becoming her thing as much as it is Kikuko Inoue's. What's funny is I was reminded on reddit that she had already played Shea's mom in a flashback, which implies that either they forgot about it and just cast her as another mom or Sayaka Ohara is going to play every characters' mom.           I imagine it was more of an intentional casting because Alicia Florence from the Aria franchise, also played by Sayaka Ohara, was the direct inspiration for Remia.  Those sorts of Easter eggs are always fun to catch when watching a show.      Back to top                  Yttrbio   Subscriber   Joined: 09 Jun 2011 		    Posts: 3535       Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 1:23 pm            I liked the discussion at the end just in terms of its applicability to these harems in general. Every show has a clear "first place girl" but it's never acknowledged like it is here.      Back to top                  Kamijou Touma    Joined: 01 Oct 2017 		    Posts: 94 		    Location: Gakuen Toshi 		        Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 2:29 pm            I love this weeks episode.  Finally Hajime told Kaori what had to be said.  I am glad that Satou Rina's character finally appeared.      Back to top                  Cryten    Joined: 19 Jan 2019 		    Posts: 541       Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 5:40 pm            Overall an interesting episode, mostly for struggling Kaori. Without it I fear that the only interesting part was the slime / jelly fish monster with nothing for them to kill. I am glad they decided to leave as the show rarely considers battles where the Chuni team does anything but overwhelm their opponents.   The speed of the naval battle moment really makes me wonder what actually happened. I mean if magic can destroy the illusion couldnt they just use the smallest beads of magic and spread them out? But no we just get a quip about destroying them all and cut to blank. That was unsatisfying to me. I like battles where triumph comes through technique.   Its been a few years since season 1, can someone reminds me how he got the crystal eye thing? I dont remember it ever being a factor before now. It really is very sterotypically chuni. The eye of darkness that must remain sealed kinda thing but with a cheap pirate eyepatch from a kids dress up store. Title: EP. REVIEW: Arifureta - From Commonplace to World's Strongest Season 2 [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: Goto page 1, 2, 3  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        FilthyCasual    Joined: 01 Jun 2015 		    Posts: 1682       Posted: Thu Jan 20, 2022 8:32 pm            Enjoyable popcorn with entertaining interactions and reasonably drawn, if not particularly dynamic, combat.     I'm glad to have Arifureta back looking better than ever.      Back to top                  Yttrbio   Subscriber   Joined: 09 Jun 2011 		    Posts: 3535       Posted: Thu Jan 20, 2022 8:44 pm            I don't know if there's a version of these fights that's engaging, but even the characters seem bored with the idea. I'm generally pretty "done" with anime fighting as it is, but this show's feels especially perfunctory. No passion, no stakes, no creativity. They really brought out the level of excitement "I guess I have to go farm 100 lava snakes at Hot Mountain for this quest" or "I wonder what it looks like when I use this new weapon" triggers when you encounter it in an MMO. Digging a hole came across as more interesting.   I stick around for the slightly-pointy banter, though, and hey, maybe what I assume is some kind of Angel Beam heralds something a bit more gripping.      Back to top                  TarsTarkas    Joined: 20 Dec 2007 		    Posts: 5253 		    Location: Virginia, United States 		        Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 3:46 am            As a fan of the franchise, the anime will still be a must watch for me, no matter how bad it could get.   My main concern is how the second season will handle the content, that was skipped over in the first season.  Since the first season was nothing more than a travelogue.   spoiler[They glossed over Verbergen and skipped the encounters with the Hoelscher Empire.]  It would be a shame if they excised these from the anime, since spoiler[ the blood bath in the Empire was a glorious moment in the light novel]      Back to top                  Cryten    Joined: 19 Jan 2019 		    Posts: 541       Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 6:13 am            Well I cant get as much fun dunking on the series anymore, since its actually competent now even if it doesnt stand out. Actually from the preview I thought it might be a bunch of stills again but we are normally getting at least a few frames of swinging a weapon animation now. Its a plus!   Though without it being atrocious it feels a bit more average now. Perhaps that is because we have had a few more of the chuni style wacky leads in the last 2 years. Like Kemono Michi, Combatants will be dispatched and quite a few I rule out as close to chuni but not overtly such as Reincarnated as a Spider and Fruit of Evolution.   For ep 2, I dont believe for a single second that Hajime could be threatened. More likely the old staple of getting his reward stolen to try and create a credible threat. Though I think the series would more likely go for just overwhelming a foe who thinks he's got him on the hop.      Back to top                  borisdrakoni    Joined: 27 Apr 2019 		    Posts: 23       Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 10:17 am              TarsTarkas wrote:    As a fan of the franchise, the anime will still be a must watch for me, no matter how bad it could get.   My main concern is how the second season will handle the content, that was skipped over in the first season.  Since the first season was nothing more than a travelogue.   spoiler[They glossed over Verbergen and skipped the encounters with the Hoelscher Empire.]  It would be a shame if they excised these from the anime, since spoiler[ the blood bath in the Empire was a glorious moment in the light novel]      There's always the possibility that this season won't get to the part in the story where the skipped content from season 1 becomes relevant.   The pacing so far has been fairly steady, and with only 12 aired episodes listed volume 6 would probably be a better stopping point.  As far as the spoiler[Empire] is concerned, I wouldn't be too surprised if at least spoiler[Gahard] was retroactively introduced here in the next couple of episodes when the story checks in on the Hero party side since spoiler[they don't have much to do for awhile].   So far, I've been enjoying the second season.  Though far from top tier, the animation quality is noticeably improved, and the writing doesn't seem to be in as big of a hurry as season 1 to speed run through the content.  The new opening and ending themes are quite good, and Ryou Takahashi's work on the bgms is as on point as always.  Of course, the return of the weekly Twitter shorts are also a welcome injection of comedy into the story.  We'll have to see where things go, but from the first two episodes at least there's plenty of room for some cautious optimism.      Back to top                  sadoldguy    Joined: 01 Aug 2009 		    Posts: 38       Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 11:07 am            "Make out" session, right.  I tolerate the light novel and manga enough but never watched the first season, so my impression is that they upped the edgelord aspects but toned down the sex and violence.      Back to top                  Picky33    Joined: 09 Jul 2021 		    Posts: 215       Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 4:34 pm            After how long it's been since the first season i was surprised to get another. I really enjoyed the first season. my only worry with the first episode is they haven't done any explaining so anyone who never read the LN, Manga, Watched the first season won't have any good understandings of what's going on.    Looking at the first episode without any context it's hard to follow along. Hopefully that improves in subsequent episodes (only watched the first so far).      Back to top                  TarsTarkas    Joined: 20 Dec 2007 		    Posts: 5253 		    Location: Virginia, United States 		        Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 1:42 am            I watched the first two episodes, so this definitely is a step up from the first season.  Wished that the OP was a bit more exciting, but at least this OP was slightly better than the first season's horrible OP.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3765       Posted: Sun Jan 30, 2022 12:17 am            Even if it was because he got the drop on him, it's nice to see an antagonist that's actually giving Hajime some trouble for once.    It was nice to see some Tio spotlight and to see her proclaim her love for Hajime. I wonder if Shea will get a spotlight episode this season.    Seems like there's intrigue back with Hajime's old classmates...I almost forgot about the conspiracy going on. Dude really just doesn't get how little Hajime cares about the attempted murder or Kaori going along with him, but now he's basically asking for Hajime to kill him.   Shizuku's one weakness...cats. Catgirl Shizuku was adorable.      Back to top                  Fallout3Boi    Joined: 05 Feb 2022 		    Posts: 1       Posted: Sat Feb 05, 2022 5:14 am            My only thought? Remia's hair looks darker in the LN.   On another note though, at this point in season 2. Remia is only pretending to like Hajime as so not to hurt Myuu's feelings.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3765       Posted: Sat Feb 05, 2022 10:48 am            I love Yue just casually sitting on Hajime's crotch and undressing so she and Hajime could have sub sex. That's couple goals.    Poor Shea gives up her blood and then has to catch Hajime and Yue at the end of their lovemaking. Throw her a bone, Hajime!   I love how Kaori finally gets her moment with Hajime only for Tio to interrupt it and shove Hajime into her boobs.   Sayaka Ohara playing a hot anime mom. It's almost becoming her thing as much as it is Kikuko Inoue's. What's funny is I was reminded on reddit that she had already played Shea's mom in a flashback, which implies that either they forgot about it and just cast her as another mom or Sayaka Ohara is going to play every characters' mom.    Really curious where the intrigue in the kingdom is going and if it'll intersect with Hajime's story at all this season...and now Shizuku knows Hajime did something to Ai-chan.      Back to top                  borisdrakoni    Joined: 27 Apr 2019 		    Posts: 23       Posted: Sat Feb 05, 2022 11:54 am              MFrontier wrote:      Sayaka Ohara playing a hot anime mom. It's almost becoming her thing as much as it is Kikuko Inoue's. What's funny is I was reminded on reddit that she had already played Shea's mom in a flashback, which implies that either they forgot about it and just cast her as another mom or Sayaka Ohara is going to play every characters' mom.           I imagine it was more of an intentional casting because Alicia Florence from the Aria franchise, also played by Sayaka Ohara, was the direct inspiration for Remia.  Those sorts of Easter eggs are always fun to catch when watching a show.      Back to top                  Yttrbio   Subscriber   Joined: 09 Jun 2011 		    Posts: 3535       Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 1:23 pm            I liked the discussion at the end just in terms of its applicability to these harems in general. Every show has a clear "first place girl" but it's never acknowledged like it is here.      Back to top                  Kamijou Touma    Joined: 01 Oct 2017 		    Posts: 94 		    Location: Gakuen Toshi 		        Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 2:29 pm            I love this weeks episode.  Finally Hajime told Kaori what had to be said.  I am glad that Satou Rina's character finally appeared.      Back to top                  Cryten    Joined: 19 Jan 2019 		    Posts: 541       Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 5:40 pm            Overall an interesting episode, mostly for struggling Kaori. Without it I fear that the only interesting part was the slime / jelly fish monster with nothing for them to kill. I am glad they decided to leave as the show rarely considers battles where the Chuni team does anything but overwhelm their opponents.   The speed of the naval battle moment really makes me wonder what actually happened. I mean if magic can destroy the illusion couldnt they just use the smallest beads of magic and spread them out? But no we just get a quip about destroying them all and cut to blank. That was unsatisfying to me. I like battles where triumph comes through technique.   Its been a few years since season 1, can someone reminds me how he got the crystal eye thing? I dont remember it ever being a factor before now. It really is very sterotypically chuni. The eye of darkness that must remain sealed kinda thing but with a cheap pirate eyepatch from a kids dress up store. Title: EP. REVIEW: Arifureta - From Commonplace to World's Strongest Season 2 [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: I don't know if there's a version of these fights that's engaging, but even the characters seem bored with the idea. I'm generally pretty "done" with anime fighting as it is, but this show's feels especially perfunctory. No passion, no stakes, no creativity. They really brought out the level of excitement "I guess I have to go farm 100 lava snakes at Hot Mountain for this quest" or "I wonder what it looks like when I use this new weapon" triggers when you encounter it in an MMO. Digging a hole came across as more interesting.   I stick around for the slightly-pointy banter, though, and hey, maybe what I assume is some kind of Angel Beam heralds something a bit more gripping.

Title: EP. REVIEW: Arifureta - From Commonplace to World's Strongest Season 2 [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: As a fan of the franchise, the anime will still be a must watch for me, no matter how bad it could get.   My main concern is how the second season will handle the content, that was skipped over in the first season.  Since the first season was nothing more than a travelogue.   spoiler[They glossed over Verbergen and skipped the encounters with the Hoelscher Empire.]  It would be a shame if they excised these from the anime, since spoiler[ the blood bath in the Empire was a glorious moment in the light novel]

Title: EP. REVIEW: Arifureta - From Commonplace to World's Strongest Season 2 [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: TarsTarkas wrote:    As a fan of the franchise, the anime will still be a must watch for me, no matter how bad it could get.   My main concern is how the second season will handle the content, that was skipped over in the first season.  Since the first season was nothing more than a travelogue.   spoiler[They glossed over Verbergen and skipped the encounters with the Hoelscher Empire.]  It would be a shame if they excised these from the anime, since spoiler[ the blood bath in the Empire was a glorious moment in the light novel]      There's always the possibility that this season won't get to the part in the story where the skipped content from season 1 becomes relevant.   The pacing so far has been fairly steady, and with only 12 aired episodes listed volume 6 would probably be a better stopping point.  As far as the spoiler[Empire] is concerned, I wouldn't be too surprised if at least spoiler[Gahard] was retroactively introduced here in the next couple of episodes when the story checks in on the Hero party side since spoiler[they don't have much to do for awhile].   So far, I've been enjoying the second season.  Though far from top tier, the animation quality is noticeably improved, and the writing doesn't seem to be in as big of a hurry as season 1 to speed run through the content.  The new opening and ending themes are quite good, and Ryou Takahashi's work on the bgms is as on point as always.  Of course, the return of the weekly Twitter shorts are also a welcome injection of comedy into the story.  We'll have to see where things go, but from the first two episodes at least there's plenty of room for some cautious optimism.

Title: EP. REVIEW: Arifureta - From Commonplace to World's Strongest Season 2 [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: I love Yue just casually sitting on Hajime's crotch and undressing so she and Hajime could have sub sex. That's couple goals.    Poor Shea gives up her blood and then has to catch Hajime and Yue at the end of their lovemaking. Throw her a bone, Hajime!   I love how Kaori finally gets her moment with Hajime only for Tio to interrupt it and shove Hajime into her boobs.   Sayaka Ohara playing a hot anime mom. It's almost becoming her thing as much as it is Kikuko Inoue's. What's funny is I was reminded on reddit that she had already played Shea's mom in a flashback, which implies that either they forgot about it and just cast her as another mom or Sayaka Ohara is going to play every characters' mom.    Really curious where the intrigue in the kingdom is going and if it'll intersect with Hajime's story at all this season...and now Shizuku knows Hajime did something to Ai-chan.

Data: Shorts show high school soccer player's life days before heading to Tokyo ― The official YouTube channel for Shogakukan's Big Comic family of magazines began streaming 11 live-action promotional shorts for the television anime of Yūgo Kobayashi's Aoashi manga on Monday. News Made in Abyss Anime Season 2 Unveils July Premiere, New Visual   posted on 2022-04-02 09:45 UTC-8 by Egan Loo          The Golden City of the Scorching Sun season casts Misaki Kuno, Yuka Terasaki, Hiroaki Hirata, Mitsuki Saiga     The staff for Made in Abyss: Retsujitsu no Ōgonkyō (Made in Abyss: The Golden City of the Scorching Sun), the second television anime season based on Akihito Tsukushi's Made in Abyss manga, posted the anime's July premiere and a new visual on Saturday.       The three main cast members are returning, alongside several new cast additions:     Miyu Tomita as Riko   Mariya Ise as Reg   Shiori Izawa as Nanachi   Misaki Kuno as Faputa  Yuka Terasaki as Vueko  Hiroaki Hirata as Wazukyan   Mitsuki Saiga as Belaf   The returning staff includes:    Director: Masayuki Kojima  Assistant Director: Hitoshi Haga  Series Composition, Scripts: Hideyuki Kurata  Character Design: Kazuchika Kise (Production I.G) Color design: Miyao Yamashita  Director of Photography: Tsunetaka Ema (T2 Studio)   Sound Director: Yō Yamada  Sound Effects: Toru Noguchi  Music: Kevin Penkin  Music producer: Hiromitsu Iijima  Music Production: Irma la Douce  Animation Production: Kinema Citrus    In addition, Yuka Kuroda joins Kise as the second character designer. The first season's prop designer Takeshi Takakura is now the design leader, with Takumi Sakura credited as the new season's prop designer. Inspired's Teru Sekiguchi joins Osamu Masuyama as the second art director. Masayuki Kurosawa is editing.  Kadokawa is collaborating on music production.    Sentai Filmworks licensed the second season for release in digital and home video this year.    In the story of Made in Abyss, an enormous pit and cave system called the "Abyss" is the only unexplored place in the world. Strange and wonderful creatures reside in its depths, and it is full of precious relics that current humans are unable to make. The mysteries of the Abyss fascinate humans, and they head down to explore. The adventurers who venture into pit are known as "Cave Raiders." A little orphan girl named Riko lives in the town of Ōrth on the edge of the Abyss. Her dream is to become a Cave Raider like her mother and solve the mysteries of the cave system. One day, Riko starts exploring the caves and discovers a robot who resembles a human boy.    Tsukushi launched the manga on Takeshobo's Web Comic Gamma website in 2012. Seven Seas is publishing the manga in English. News Made in Abyss Anime Season 2 Unveils July Premiere, New Visual   posted on 2022-04-02 09:45 UTC-8 by Egan Loo          The Golden City of the Scorching Sun season casts Misaki Kuno, Yuka Terasaki, Hiroaki Hirata, Mitsuki Saiga     The staff for Made in Abyss: Retsujitsu no Ōgonkyō (Made in Abyss: The Golden City of the Scorching Sun), the second television anime season based on Akihito Tsukushi's Made in Abyss manga, posted the anime's July premiere and a new visual on Saturday.       The three main cast members are returning, alongside several new cast additions:     Miyu Tomita as Riko   Mariya Ise as Reg   Shiori Izawa as Nanachi   Misaki Kuno as Faputa  Yuka Terasaki as Vueko  Hiroaki Hirata as Wazukyan   Mitsuki Saiga as Belaf   The returning staff includes:    Director: Masayuki Kojima  Assistant Director: Hitoshi Haga  Series Composition, Scripts: Hideyuki Kurata  Character Design: Kazuchika Kise (Production I.G) Color design: Miyao Yamashita  Director of Photography: Tsunetaka Ema (T2 Studio)   Sound Director: Yō Yamada  Sound Effects: Toru Noguchi  Music: Kevin Penkin  Music producer: Hiromitsu Iijima  Music Production: Irma la Douce  Animation Production: Kinema Citrus    In addition, Yuka Kuroda joins Kise as the second character designer. The first season's prop designer Takeshi Takakura is now the design leader, with Takumi Sakura credited as the new season's prop designer. Inspired's Teru Sekiguchi joins Osamu Masuyama as the second art director. Masayuki Kurosawa is editing.  Kadokawa is collaborating on music production.    Sentai Filmworks licensed the second season for release in digital and home video this year.    In the story of Made in Abyss, an enormous pit and cave system called the "Abyss" is the only unexplored place in the world. Strange and wonderful creatures reside in its depths, and it is full of precious relics that current humans are unable to make. The mysteries of the Abyss fascinate humans, and they head down to explore. The adventurers who venture into pit are known as "Cave Raiders." A little orphan girl named Riko lives in the town of Ōrth on the edge of the Abyss. Her dream is to become a Cave Raider like her mother and solve the mysteries of the cave system. One day, Riko starts exploring the caves and discovers a robot who resembles a human boy.    Tsukushi launched the manga on Takeshobo's Web Comic Gamma website in 2012. Seven Seas is publishing the manga in English.      Sources: Made in Abyss anime's website, Kadokawa Anime's Twitter account, Comic Natalie        discuss this in the forum (7 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history     News homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            feature          38 comments       The Spring 2022 Preview Guide   Apr  2, 08:13 38 comments                 anime    It's time to get the party started! News Made in Abyss Anime Season 2 Unveils July Premiere, New Visual   posted on 2022-04-02 09:45 UTC-8 by Egan Loo          The Golden City of the Scorching Sun season casts Misaki Kuno, Yuka Terasaki, Hiroaki Hirata, Mitsuki Saiga     The staff for Made in Abyss: Retsujitsu no Ōgonkyō (Made in Abyss: The Golden City of the Scorching Sun), the second television anime season based on Akihito Tsukushi's Made in Abyss manga, posted the anime's July premiere and a new visual on Saturday.       The three main cast members are returning, alongside several new cast additions:     Miyu Tomita as Riko   Mariya Ise as Reg   Shiori Izawa as Nanachi   Misaki Kuno as Faputa  Yuka Terasaki as Vueko  Hiroaki Hirata as Wazukyan   Mitsuki Saiga as Belaf   The returning staff includes:    Director: Masayuki Kojima  Assistant Director: Hitoshi Haga  Series Composition, Scripts: Hideyuki Kurata  Character Design: Kazuchika Kise (Production I.G) Color design: Miyao Yamashita  Director of Photography: Tsunetaka Ema (T2 Studio)   Sound Director: Yō Yamada  Sound Effects: Toru Noguchi  Music: Kevin Penkin  Music producer: Hiromitsu Iijima  Music Production: Irma la Douce  Animation Production: Kinema Citrus    In addition, Yuka Kuroda joins Kise as the second character designer. The first season's prop designer Takeshi Takakura is now the design leader, with Takumi Sakura credited as the new season's prop designer. Inspired's Teru Sekiguchi joins Osamu Masuyama as the second art director. Masayuki Kurosawa is editing.  Kadokawa is collaborating on music production.    Sentai Filmworks licensed the second season for release in digital and home video this year.    In the story of Made in Abyss, an enormous pit and cave system called the "Abyss" is the only unexplored place in the world. Strange and wonderful creatures reside in its depths, and it is full of precious relics that current humans are unable to make. The mysteries of the Abyss fascinate humans, and they head down to explore. The adventurers who venture into pit are known as "Cave Raiders." A little orphan girl named Riko lives in the town of Ōrth on the edge of the Abyss. Her dream is to become a Cave Raider like her mother and solve the mysteries of the cave system. One day, Riko starts exploring the caves and discovers a robot who resembles a human boy.    Tsukushi launched the manga on Takeshobo's Web Comic Gamma website in 2012. Seven Seas is publishing the manga in English. News Made in Abyss Anime Season 2 Unveils July Premiere, New Visual   posted on 2022-04-02 09:45 UTC-8 by Egan Loo          The Golden City of the Scorching Sun season casts Misaki Kuno, Yuka Terasaki, Hiroaki Hirata, Mitsuki Saiga     The staff for Made in Abyss: Retsujitsu no Ōgonkyō (Made in Abyss: The Golden City of the Scorching Sun), the second television anime season based on Akihito Tsukushi's Made in Abyss manga, posted the anime's July premiere and a new visual on Saturday.       The three main cast members are returning, alongside several new cast additions:     Miyu Tomita as Riko   Mariya Ise as Reg   Shiori Izawa as Nanachi   Misaki Kuno as Faputa  Yuka Terasaki as Vueko  Hiroaki Hirata as Wazukyan   Mitsuki Saiga as Belaf   The returning staff includes:    Director: Masayuki Kojima  Assistant Director: Hitoshi Haga  Series Composition, Scripts: Hideyuki Kurata  Character Design: Kazuchika Kise (Production I.G) Color design: Miyao Yamashita  Director of Photography: Tsunetaka Ema (T2 Studio)   Sound Director: Yō Yamada  Sound Effects: Toru Noguchi  Music: Kevin Penkin  Music producer: Hiromitsu Iijima  Music Production: Irma la Douce  Animation Production: Kinema Citrus    In addition, Yuka Kuroda joins Kise as the second character designer. The first season's prop designer Takeshi Takakura is now the design leader, with Takumi Sakura credited as the new season's prop designer. Inspired's Teru Sekiguchi joins Osamu Masuyama as the second art director. Masayuki Kurosawa is editing.  Kadokawa is collaborating on music production.    Sentai Filmworks licensed the second season for release in digital and home video this year.    In the story of Made in Abyss, an enormous pit and cave system called the "Abyss" is the only unexplored place in the world. Strange and wonderful creatures reside in its depths, and it is full of precious relics that current humans are unable to make. The mysteries of the Abyss fascinate humans, and they head down to explore. The adventurers who venture into pit are known as "Cave Raiders." A little orphan girl named Riko lives in the town of Ōrth on the edge of the Abyss. Her dream is to become a Cave Raider like her mother and solve the mysteries of the cave system. One day, Riko starts exploring the caves and discovers a robot who resembles a human boy.    Tsukushi launched the manga on Takeshobo's Web Comic Gamma website in 2012. Seven Seas is publishing the manga in English. Data: News Made in Abyss Anime Season 2 Unveils July Premiere, New Visual   posted on 2022-04-02 09:45 UTC-8 by Egan Loo          The Golden City of the Scorching Sun season casts Misaki Kuno, Yuka Terasaki, Hiroaki Hirata, Mitsuki Saiga     The staff for Made in Abyss: Retsujitsu no Ōgonkyō (Made in Abyss: The Golden City of the Scorching Sun), the second television anime season based on Akihito Tsukushi's Made in Abyss manga, posted the anime's July premiere and a new visual on Saturday.       The three main cast members are returning, alongside several new cast additions:     Miyu Tomita as Riko   Mariya Ise as Reg   Shiori Izawa as Nanachi   Misaki Kuno as Faputa  Yuka Terasaki as Vueko  Hiroaki Hirata as Wazukyan   Mitsuki Saiga as Belaf   The returning staff includes:    Director: Masayuki Kojima  Assistant Director: Hitoshi Haga  Series Composition, Scripts: Hideyuki Kurata  Character Design: Kazuchika Kise (Production I.G) Color design: Miyao Yamashita  Director of Photography: Tsunetaka Ema (T2 Studio)   Sound Director: Yō Yamada  Sound Effects: Toru Noguchi  Music: Kevin Penkin  Music producer: Hiromitsu Iijima  Music Production: Irma la Douce  Animation Production: Kinema Citrus    In addition, Yuka Kuroda joins Kise as the second character designer. The first season's prop designer Takeshi Takakura is now the design leader, with Takumi Sakura credited as the new season's prop designer. Inspired's Teru Sekiguchi joins Osamu Masuyama as the second art director. Masayuki Kurosawa is editing.  Kadokawa is collaborating on music production.    Sentai Filmworks licensed the second season for release in digital and home video this year.    In the story of Made in Abyss, an enormous pit and cave system called the "Abyss" is the only unexplored place in the world. Strange and wonderful creatures reside in its depths, and it is full of precious relics that current humans are unable to make. The mysteries of the Abyss fascinate humans, and they head down to explore. The adventurers who venture into pit are known as "Cave Raiders." A little orphan girl named Riko lives in the town of Ōrth on the edge of the Abyss. Her dream is to become a Cave Raider like her mother and solve the mysteries of the cave system. One day, Riko starts exploring the caves and discovers a robot who resembles a human boy.    Tsukushi launched the manga on Takeshobo's Web Comic Gamma website in 2012. Seven Seas is publishing the manga in English.      Sources: Made in Abyss anime's website, Kadokawa Anime's Twitter account, Comic Natalie        discuss this in the forum (7 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history     News homepage / archives

Interest Anime/Manga/Game Industry Celebrates April Fool's Day 2022   posted on 2022-04-02 00:45 UTC-8 by Kim Morrissy         Roundup of joke announcements from Made in Abyss, Love Live!, Shadows House, Kaguya-sama, more    It's that time of the year again: the cherry blossoms fall, and the April Fool's pranks fly. Japan's anime, manga and video game industries are fun-loving enough to participate in this tradition every year. Here are some of 2022's highlights:   Made in Abyss  Made in Abyss's Prushka takes the directorial seat in a visual parodying Indiana Jones movie posters.    [Link]   Love Live!    The Love Live! franchise teased "Genjitsu no Yohane -Sunshine in the Mirror-", a new anime featuring the chuunibyou-afflicted idol Yohane as a magical girl, apparently slated for 2023. G's Magazine's Love Live! Days magazine is serializing illustrations and a comic.   Shadows House    Shadows House teases a "live-action film" (featuring puppets) with a 7-minute preview.    [Link]   Kaguya-sama: Love is War  The series released a "hidden side" visual for the Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai -Ultra Romantic- depicting the Four Ramen Emperors of Tokyo.    [Link]   The Angel Next Door Spoils Me Rotten  She can be your angel or your devil... The series releases an alternate version of the anime's key visual showing heroine Mahiru in her "little devil" form.    [Link]   Trapped in a Dating Sim: The World of Otome Games is Tough for Mobs    The anime released a promotional video for Alto Liebe, the fictional otome game the story is set in. The PV previews the handsome male love interests Julius Rapha Holfort, Jilk Fia Marmoria, Brad Fou Field, Chris Fia Arclight, and Greg Fou Seberg. The video also previews voice actors' Kenichi Suzumura, Kousuke Toriumi, Shinnosuke Tachibana, Koji Yusa, and Nobuyuki Hiyama's theme song "Supreme Love Star." The song will release on music streaming services on April 10.    [Link]   A Couple of Cuckoos  The anime releases a "cat" version of its main visual.    [Link]   Teasing Master Takagi  The series launched a free online puzzle game, titled "Nishikata Quest Online." By clearing the game, you can re-experience the TV anime's final episode.    [Link]   Azur Lane   戦い（バトル）の舞台は、青い海ではなく、暗い宇宙（そら）へ－－『　#アズールレーン　』 pic.twitter.com/fcFonIvOVZ— アズールレーン公式 (@azurlane_staff) March 31, 2022     The strategy game reimagines itself as a Super Robot War-style battle RPG with a teaser video.   BanG Dream!   ＼🌸Girl's Blossom Project🌸／ 〜 #嘘のようなホントの恋💖〜ガルパの恋愛シミュレーションゲームが、ついにリリースされました✨ぜひ、今作をお楽しみください💫満開の桜の樹の下……私はあなたと――ホントの恋に落ちる👇💕https://t.co/ugR4zNWHIG#バンドリ #ガルパ #ガルブロ— バンドリ！ ガールズバンドパーティ！ (@bang_dream_gbp) March 31, 2022     The music rhythm game released a short playable spinoff game on its website reimagining itself as a romance visual novel.   Tensei Kenja no Isekai Life  Protagonist Yuji gains another class to become the strongest—not as a sage but as a buff bodybuilder.    [Link]   Nekopara  Neko Works announces a dog version of the catgirl-themed visual novel series, titled Inupara: Dogs Paradise. Inupara stars six different dog girls each representing a popular breed. The game's protagonist is a college student who shuns the usual social life in favor of spending quality time with his two dogs. One day, he wakes up to find his faithful pooches transformed into girls.     #INUPARA pic.twitter.com/xtxuYTKBhx— NEKO WORKs/NEKOPARA Official (@nekopara_pr) March 31, 2022     The hypothetical game's opening video is streaming on YouTube and includes the theme song "Inu no Ōta" by singer Nanahira.      Don't Hurt Me, My Healer! & Healer Girl   The two healer-themed anime released a crossover visual.    Masamune-kun's Revenge The Masamune-kun's Revenge anime released a comic strip jokingly announcing a "season 3." In the illustration, Yoshino Koiwai is shown reaching for a sign reading "Season 3 production confirmed," while Aki Adagaki points out: "What are you doing? Before you can announce season 3, you have to announce season 2! Interest Anime/Manga/Game Industry Celebrates April Fool's Day 2022   posted on 2022-04-02 00:45 UTC-8 by Kim Morrissy         Roundup of joke announcements from Made in Abyss, Love Live!, Shadows House, Kaguya-sama, more    It's that time of the year again: the cherry blossoms fall, and the April Fool's pranks fly. Japan's anime, manga and video game industries are fun-loving enough to participate in this tradition every year. Here are some of 2022's highlights:   Made in Abyss  Made in Abyss's Prushka takes the directorial seat in a visual parodying Indiana Jones movie posters.    [Link]   Love Live!    The Love Live! franchise teased "Genjitsu no Yohane -Sunshine in the Mirror-", a new anime featuring the chuunibyou-afflicted idol Yohane as a magical girl, apparently slated for 2023. G's Magazine's Love Live! Days magazine is serializing illustrations and a comic.   Shadows House    Shadows House teases a "live-action film" (featuring puppets) with a 7-minute preview.    [Link]   Kaguya-sama: Love is War  The series released a "hidden side" visual for the Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai -Ultra Romantic- depicting the Four Ramen Emperors of Tokyo.    [Link]   The Angel Next Door Spoils Me Rotten  She can be your angel or your devil... The series releases an alternate version of the anime's key visual showing heroine Mahiru in her "little devil" form.    [Link]   Trapped in a Dating Sim: The World of Otome Games is Tough for Mobs    The anime released a promotional video for Alto Liebe, the fictional otome game the story is set in. The PV previews the handsome male love interests Julius Rapha Holfort, Jilk Fia Marmoria, Brad Fou Field, Chris Fia Arclight, and Greg Fou Seberg. The video also previews voice actors' Kenichi Suzumura, Kousuke Toriumi, Shinnosuke Tachibana, Koji Yusa, and Nobuyuki Hiyama's theme song "Supreme Love Star." The song will release on music streaming services on April 10.    [Link]   A Couple of Cuckoos  The anime releases a "cat" version of its main visual.    [Link]   Teasing Master Takagi  The series launched a free online puzzle game, titled "Nishikata Quest Online." By clearing the game, you can re-experience the TV anime's final episode.    [Link]   Azur Lane   戦い（バトル）の舞台は、青い海ではなく、暗い宇宙（そら）へ－－『　#アズールレーン　』 pic.twitter.com/fcFonIvOVZ— アズールレーン公式 (@azurlane_staff) March 31, 2022     The strategy game reimagines itself as a Super Robot War-style battle RPG with a teaser video.   BanG Dream!   ＼🌸Girl's Blossom Project🌸／ 〜 #嘘のようなホントの恋💖〜ガルパの恋愛シミュレーションゲームが、ついにリリースされました✨ぜひ、今作をお楽しみください💫満開の桜の樹の下……私はあなたと――ホントの恋に落ちる👇💕https://t.co/ugR4zNWHIG#バンドリ #ガルパ #ガルブロ— バンドリ！ ガールズバンドパーティ！ (@bang_dream_gbp) March 31, 2022     The music rhythm game released a short playable spinoff game on its website reimagining itself as a romance visual novel.   Tensei Kenja no Isekai Life  Protagonist Yuji gains another class to become the strongest—not as a sage but as a buff bodybuilder.    [Link]   Nekopara  Neko Works announces a dog version of the catgirl-themed visual novel series, titled Inupara: Dogs Paradise. Inupara stars six different dog girls each representing a popular breed. The game's protagonist is a college student who shuns the usual social life in favor of spending quality time with his two dogs. One day, he wakes up to find his faithful pooches transformed into girls.     #INUPARA pic.twitter.com/xtxuYTKBhx— NEKO WORKs/NEKOPARA Official (@nekopara_pr) March 31, 2022     The hypothetical game's opening video is streaming on YouTube and includes the theme song "Inu no Ōta" by singer Nanahira.      Don't Hurt Me, My Healer! & Healer Girl   The two healer-themed anime released a crossover visual.    Masamune-kun's Revenge The Masamune-kun's Revenge anime released a comic strip jokingly announcing a "season 3." In the illustration, Yoshino Koiwai is shown reaching for a sign reading "Season 3 production confirmed," while Aki Adagaki points out: "What are you doing? Before you can announce season 3, you have to announce season 2! Take that down!"          discuss this in the forum (11 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                Interest homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            feature          38 comments       The Spring 2022 Preview Guide   Apr  2, 08:13 38 comments                 anime    It's time to get the party started! Title: Anime/Manga/Game Industry Celebrates April Fool's Day 2022 - Interest - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ×  remind me tomorrow remind me next week never remind me      Subscribe to the ANN Newsletter • Wake up every Sunday to a curated list of ANN's most interesting posts of the week.    read more           ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             Interest Anime/Manga/Game Industry Celebrates April Fool's Day 2022   posted on 2022-04-02 00:45 UTC-8 by Kim Morrissy         Roundup of joke announcements from Made in Abyss, Love Live!, Shadows House, Kaguya-sama, more    It's that time of the year again: the cherry blossoms fall, and the April Fool's pranks fly. Japan's anime, manga and video game industries are fun-loving enough to participate in this tradition every year. Here are some of 2022's highlights:   Made in Abyss  Made in Abyss's Prushka takes the directorial seat in a visual parodying Indiana Jones movie posters.    [Link]   Love Live!    The Love Live! franchise teased "Genjitsu no Yohane -Sunshine in the Mirror-", a new anime featuring the chuunibyou-afflicted idol Yohane as a magical girl, apparently slated for 2023. G's Magazine's Love Live! Days magazine is serializing illustrations and a comic.   Shadows House    Shadows House teases a "live-action film" (featuring puppets) with a 7-minute preview.    [Link]   Kaguya-sama: Love is War  The series released a "hidden side" visual for the Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai -Ultra Romantic- depicting the Four Ramen Emperors of Tokyo.    [Link]   The Angel Next Door Spoils Me Rotten  She can be your angel or your devil... The series releases an alternate version of the anime's key visual showing heroine Mahiru in her "little devil" form.    [Link]   Trapped in a Dating Sim: The World of Otome Games is Tough for Mobs    The anime released a promotional video for Alto Liebe, the fictional otome game the story is set in. The PV previews the handsome male love interests Julius Rapha Holfort, Jilk Fia Marmoria, Brad Fou Field, Chris Fia Arclight, and Greg Fou Seberg. The video also previews voice actors' Kenichi Suzumura, Kousuke Toriumi, Shinnosuke Tachibana, Koji Yusa, and Nobuyuki Hiyama's theme song "Supreme Love Star." The song will release on music streaming services on April 10.    [Link]   A Couple of Cuckoos  The anime releases a "cat" version of its main visual.    [Link]   Teasing Master Takagi  The series launched a free online puzzle game, titled "Nishikata Quest Online." By clearing the game, you can re-experience the TV anime's final episode.    [Link]   Azur Lane   戦い（バトル）の舞台は、青い海ではなく、暗い宇宙（そら）へ－－『　#アズールレーン　』 pic.twitter.com/fcFonIvOVZ— アズールレーン公式 (@azurlane_staff) March 31, 2022     The strategy game reimagines itself as a Super Robot War-style battle RPG with a teaser video.   BanG Dream!   ＼🌸Girl's Blossom Project🌸／ 〜 #嘘のようなホントの恋💖〜ガルパの恋愛シミュレーションゲームが、ついにリリースされました✨ぜひ、今作をお楽しみください💫満開の桜の樹の下……私はあなたと――ホントの恋に落ちる👇💕https://t.co/ugR4zNWHIG#バンドリ #ガルパ #ガルブロ— バンドリ！ ガールズバンドパーティ！ (@bang_dream_gbp) March 31, 2022     The music rhythm game released a short playable spinoff game on its website reimagining itself as a romance visual novel.   Tensei Kenja no Isekai Life  Protagonist Yuji gains another class to become the strongest—not as a sage but as a buff bodybuilder.    [Link]   Nekopara  Neko Works announces a dog version of the catgirl-themed visual novel series, titled Inupara: Dogs Paradise. Inupara stars six different dog girls each representing a popular breed. The game's protagonist is a college student who shuns the usual social life in favor of spending quality time with his two dogs. One day, he wakes up to find his faithful pooches transformed into girls.     #INUPARA pic.twitter.com/xtxuYTKBhx— NEKO WORKs/NEKOPARA Official (@nekopara_pr) March 31, 2022     The hypothetical game's opening video is streaming on YouTube and includes the theme song "Inu no Ōta" by singer Nanahira.      Don't Hurt Me, My Healer! & Healer Girl   The two healer-themed anime released a crossover visual.    Masamune-kun's Revenge The Masamune-kun's Revenge anime released a comic strip jokingly announcing a "season 3." In the illustration, Yoshino Koiwai is shown reaching for a sign reading "Season 3 production confirmed," while Aki Adagaki points out: "What are you doing? Before you can announce season 3, you have to announce season 2! Take that down!"          discuss this in the forum (11 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                Interest homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More

BanG Dream!   ＼🌸Girl's Blossom Project🌸／ 〜 #嘘のようなホントの恋💖〜ガルパの恋愛シミュレーションゲームが、ついにリリースされました✨ぜひ、今作をお楽しみください💫満開の桜の樹の下……私はあなたと――ホントの恋に落ちる👇💕https://t.co/ugR4zNWHIG#バンドリ #ガルパ #ガルブロ— バンドリ！ ガールズバンドパーティ！ (@bang_dream_gbp) March 31, 2022     The music rhythm game released a short playable spinoff game on its website reimagining itself as a romance visual novel.   Tensei Kenja no Isekai Life  Protagonist Yuji gains another class to become the strongest—not as a sage but as a buff bodybuilder.    [Link]   Nekopara  Neko Works announces a dog version of the catgirl-themed visual novel series, titled Inupara: Dogs Paradise. Inupara stars six different dog girls each representing a popular breed. The game's protagonist is a college student who shuns the usual social life in favor of spending quality time with his two dogs. One day, he wakes up to find his faithful pooches transformed into girls.     #INUPARA pic.twitter.com/xtxuYTKBhx— NEKO WORKs/NEKOPARA Official (@nekopara_pr) March 31, 2022     The hypothetical game's opening video is streaming on YouTube and includes the theme song "Inu no Ōta" by singer Nanahira.      Don't Hurt Me, My Healer! & Healer Girl   The two healer-themed anime released a crossover visual.    Masamune-kun's Revenge The Masamune-kun's Revenge anime released a comic strip jokingly announcing a "season 3." In the illustration, Yoshino Koiwai is shown reaching for a sign reading "Season 3 production confirmed," while Aki Adagaki points out: "What are you doing? Take that down!"          discuss this in the forum (11 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                Interest homepage / archives

Title: Anime/Manga/Game Industry Celebrates April Fool's Day 2022 - Interest - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ⬈ ⬋ - +                            feature          38 comments       The Spring 2022 Preview Guide   Apr  2, 08:13 38 comments                 anime    It's time to get the party started! ANN's preview guide is live with reviews of The Executioner and Her Way of Life, Science Fell in Love, Ya Boy, Kongming!, Legend of Galactic Heroes, Estab-Life, Kotaro Lives Alone, and Thermae Romae Novae! ― Adblock+ breaks this page, consider whitelisting ANN Welcome to Anime News Network's Spring 2022 Preview Guide! Here's how it goes: our team of critics write u...                    news          17 comments       'The Fruit of Evolution: Before I Knew It, My Life Had It Made' Novels Get New TV Anime   Apr  2, 08:00 17 comments                 anime    'Evolved' title adds 'Shin' prefix ― The official Twitter account for the anime of Miku and U35's Shinka no Mi ~Shiranai Uchi ni Kachigumi Jinsei~ (The Fruit of Evolution ~Before I Knew It, My Life Had It Made~) light novel series announced on Friday that a new television anime adaptation has been green-lit. The "evolved" new title is Shin Shinka no Mi ~Shiranai Uchi ni Kachigumi Jinsei~ (True: The F...                    daily briefs          23 comments       Netflix: More Than Half of Members Globally Watched 'Anime' Last Year   Apr  1, 23:04 23 comments                 anime    Director of anime creative at Netflix Kohei Obara revealed to entertainment magazine Variety on Monday that "more than half" of Netflix's worldwide audience watched "anime" last year. The number expands to 90% for Japanese Netflix subscribers. Netflix classifies Japanese animated titles as well as several Western animated titles as "anime." Obara stated, "anime is one of the cornerstones of [Netfl...                    news          8 comments       E3 Game Show Cancels 2022 Event   Apr  1, 23:02 8 comments                 events    E3 returns in 2023 ― The Entertainment Software Association (ESA) revealed to IGN on Thursday that it has canceled this year's E3 event, and there will not be an in-person or digital component. The ESA revealed that E3 will return in 2023 with "a reinvigorated showcase" "live from Los Angeles." The ESA plans to "focus its resources" on the 2023 show. The ESA had announced the cancellation of the in-p...                    news          7 comments       BookLive Suspends Ranking of Kings Manga's English Release for Retranslation   Apr  1, 23:00 7 comments                 manga    Original English release had errors, inadequate translations ― E-book publisher BookLive announced on Thursday that it is suspending the distribution of the English version of Sōsuke Tōka's Ranking of Kings (Ōsama Ranking) manga, and is in the process of retranslating the series. BookLive began distributing the manga's first seven volumes in English on February 18, but readers have pointed out typogr...                    watch          5 comments       Gundam Build Fighters and the Power of Toy Anime   Apr  1, 22:00 5 comments                 anime    Gundam Build Fighters is a toy show through and through.
